instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message:
No shots or liquid on the board
CD32s seem fine, with no heat signature.

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message:
Any history available?
The original battery is detected at least?
Did you try known good battery?

You should check if DFU mode helps.

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message:
No liquid damage history. The owner is a teenager, so getting any reliable information is a challenge on its own.

Battery detected and shows good health, only 3% left, scared that might drain mid-DFU restore.
Its the original battery that came with the mac. I will try to source a spare one to try to run DFU and test charging.

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message:
Fitted a top case from another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Turns on and works, Diagnostic comes with:
[B]There might be an issue with the power port PPP001[/B]

Failed to push it to DFU restore mode. Have another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> here which went into DFu mode. The setup seems to be correct. Just this one doesn't want to enter.

Any other suggestions, apart than wire the PCB to enter DFU

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips with the other board.

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message:
Diode mode readings match with slight variations of under 0.1.
Other areas to look to?

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not charging the original battery. Turns on and works fine - 5V 0.02A
threads.message: You were right, gunk under the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>. Reflowed and came back to life. Thanks again
